title: How to Make Vegan Cinnamon Rolls

steps.headline: Spread vegan butter over two foil pans.
steps.description: Rub about a tablespoon of butter on each pan, spreading it all over the surface and edges. Set aside.

steps.headline: Combine the melted butter, almond milk, and sugar in a large bowl.
steps.description: Beat well with a whisk. The mixture should be slightly warm (100–110 °F (38–43 °C)) and at room temperature. If the mixture is too hot, leave it to cool for a few minutes before using. The mixture must be at an appropriate warm temperature or the dough won't form properly.

steps.headline: Sprinkle the yeast over the mixture.
steps.description: Leave it to sit for about a minute.

steps.headline: Add the salt and five cups of flour to the mixture.
steps.description: Stir with a wooden spoon until the ingredients are fully incorporated together.

steps.headline: Cover the bowl with plastic wrap or a towel.
steps.description: Set it aside in a warm area to rise for about an hour.

parts.name: Making the Cinnamon Rolls with the Filling

steps.headline: Add the remaining flour to the bowl.
steps.description: Remove the plastic wrap or towel off the bowl. Combine in the remaining ½ cup (95 grams) of flour and mix well.

steps.headline: Knead the dough on a floured surface.
steps.description: While kneading, add extra flour if the dough is still sticky. The dough should not stick to its surface and should be easy to knead.

steps.headline: Roll the dough out into the shape of a rectangle.
steps.description: Using a rolling pin, spread the dough out so that it's about ⁄2 inch (1 cm) thick. Adjust the corners so that it stays even.

steps.headline: Spread the vegan butter all over the dough with a butter knife.
Sprinkle the cinnamon and brown sugar evenly on top.
Roll the dough into the shape of a log.
steps.description: Carefully roll the dough so it can resemble a log and then close the seams by pinching them. Cut off any excess dough at the edges with kitchen scissors.

steps.headline: Slice off pieces of the dough to create a cinnamon roll.
steps.description: This can be tricky to do with a knife so you may prefer using dental floss for easier slicing. Each cinnamon roll should be about 1 ⁄2 inches (4 cm)  thick.

steps.headline: Place the cinnamon rolls in the foil pans and set aside.
steps.description: Cover the pans with plastic wrap and set it aside in a warm area to rise for about 30 minutes.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to  350 °F (180 °C).
Remove the plastic wrap off from the pans.
Bake the cinnamon rolls in the oven for about 25-30 minutes.
steps.description: Allow them to bake until the edges and tops are golden brown.

steps.headline: Combine the powdered sugar and almond milk in a separate bowl.
steps.description: Mix well with a whisk until smooth.

steps.headline: Add the vanilla extract.
steps.description: Mix once more until it’s well combined.

steps.headline: Remove the cinnamon rolls from the oven.
steps.description: Allow them to cool for about 10 minutes until warm.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Drizzle the icing over the cinnamon rolls with a spoon. Garnish with extra cinnamon or chopped nuts if desired. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Finished.

text: Making the Dough Spread vegan butter over two foil pans. Rub about a tablespoon of butter on each pan, spreading it all over the surface and edges. Set aside. Combine the melted butter, almond milk, and sugar in a large bowl. Beat well with a whisk. The mixture should be slightly warm (100–110 °F (38–43 °C)) and at room temperature. If the mixture is too hot, leave it to cool for a few minutes before using. The mixture must be at an appropriate warm temperature or the dough won't form properly. Sprinkle the yeast over the mixture. Leave it to sit for about a minute. Add the salt and five cups of flour to the mixture. Stir with a wooden spoon until the ingredients are fully incorporated together. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap or a towel. Set it aside in a warm area to rise for about an hour. Making the Cinnamon Rolls with the Filling Add the remaining flour to the bowl. Remove the plastic wrap or towel off the bowl. Combine in the remaining ½ cup (95 grams) of flour and mix well. Knead the dough on a floured surface. While kneading, add extra flour if the dough is still sticky. The dough should not stick to its surface and should be easy to knead. Roll the dough out into the shape of a rectangle. Using a rolling pin, spread the dough out so that it's about ⁄2 inch (1 cm) thick. Adjust the corners so that it stays even. Spread the vegan butter all over the dough with a butter knife.  Sprinkle the cinnamon and brown sugar evenly on top.  Roll the dough into the shape of a log. Carefully roll the dough so it can resemble a log and then close the seams by pinching them. Cut off any excess dough at the edges with kitchen scissors. Slice off pieces of the dough to create a cinnamon roll. This can be tricky to do with a knife so you may prefer using dental floss for easier slicing. Each cinnamon roll should be about 1 ⁄2 inches (4 cm)  thick. Place the cinnamon rolls in the foil pans and set aside. Cover the pans with plastic wrap and set it aside in a warm area to rise for about 30 minutes. Baking, Icing and Serving Preheat the oven to  350 °F (180 °C).  Remove the plastic wrap off from the pans.  Bake the cinnamon rolls in the oven for about 25-30 minutes. Allow them to bake until the edges and tops are golden brown. Combine the powdered sugar and almond milk in a separate bowl. Mix well with a whisk until smooth. Add the vanilla extract. Mix once more until it’s well combined. Remove the cinnamon rolls from the oven. Allow them to cool for about 10 minutes until warm. Serve. Drizzle the icing over the cinnamon rolls with a spoon. Garnish with extra cinnamon or chopped nuts if desired. Enjoy! Finished.
